reviewText: Oh,my goodness! Tom Selleck's longtime moustache is missing! But,what the hell? He looked handsome without it as he did with it. Selleck is Jon Aldrich,a Chicago stockbroker with a wife and two young children. Jon has parents(Anne Jackson and the late Don Ameche) in a Florida nursing home who are residentially taken into the Aldrich household by Jon. Jon's dad suffers from Alzheimer's and constantly craves McDonald's food. The dad once owned and operated a shoe store which was later taken over and sold by Jon. The sale occured as a result of the neighborhood change. The dad also follows Jon almost everywhere Jon goes and the dad is unknowingly wandering around town despite the dangerous situations. Jon's divorced sister Arlene(Christine Ebersole) has two obnoxious pre-teen sons who of course,behave obnoxiously when they and their mother show up at the Aldriches' home. Arlene becomes romantically involved with one of the Aldriches' neighbors(the late Robert Pastorelli). One funny scene was where Jon injured one of his testicles in an accident. It is surgically removed,which led to Jon exclaiming in his hospital bed,"I only have one nut!". A very funny family film! Ameche died at age 85 in 1993 and Pastorelli,late of the CBS sitcom "Murphy Brown", committed suicide last year. Selleck,without a moustache is also seen in 1997's IN & OUT and the 2000 TV movie RUNNING MATES.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie was suggested to me to view by a very good friend back home.  When I went to buy the DVD, it was out of my price range, but I did buy the VHS tape and it was so well worth the money.  I'm not in the habit of spending money on VHS tapes for they are becoming so outdated.  I was very glad I made this purchase.  I laughed from the biginning of the movie to the end.  If you want to cheer yourself up, I would recommend to anyone to buy this film.  A good laugh during these tough times is a welcome thing!!!

reviewText: If you're looking for a fun comedy this one's it. The cast of characters just work together well. They're zany, they're endearing, they're wonderful.If you're a fan of Don Ameche, this is a movie to watch  :)
summary: Funny! Don Ameche & Tom Selleck are Great!

reviewText: I always loved Tom Selleck as Magnum PI, but he definitely has a comic streak in him. Every character in this movie just added to it being a lot of fun to watch. The veteran actor Don Ameche, was in top form for this one. The supporting actors blended different kinds of humor together to put this movie on the top of the list of films to watch if you want a good laugh. Highly recommended for a good evening of laughing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Brenda, 11-13-05 says it perfectly, so i won't repeat. This movie is better appreciated by adults than children because of the Alzheimers theme. Anne Jackson is a beautiful lady, very good as a wife and mother in this movie. Don Ameche and Tom were wonderful together. Hilarious, yet poignant at times. There is one crass line by Tom's (screen) sister that should have been left out. When i showed the movie to friends in my home i was embarrassed when that line was said, as they were. otherwise a very funny, enjoyable movie. Again, why the obligatory crudity, Hollywood?

reviewText: I recently saw "Folks" for the very first time again (On YouTube), and I think it is a really cute movie.I had one heck of a time finding this movie. Have Looked in the bargain bin at Wal-Mart but never found it. Came here on Amazon to buy the DVD but the price was way too high. But I did buy the VHS tape and it was at my house in a couple of days. I am hoping to make the upgrade to DVD real soon Thanks Amazon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yours truly, Peter Smith P.S. If you have enjoyed this movie, I would also recommend "Pure Luck" starring Martin Short and Danny Glover, and "Roommates" starring Peter Falk and D.B. Sweeny!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Update for 3/27/14 I just ordered the DVD from Classicmoviereels.com for my my mom's best friend as a gift. So if anyone is looking for this DVD cheaply, I highly Recommend that website. Don't go here on amazon to buy it. I am still going to keep my VHS copy just because it has two previews for "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" and "Man Trouble" on it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
